page.title: 18Secondary education
page.content: Shelley High School opened Sept.1974. Headteacher Mr. T. Ellison. 78 teaching staff, 3 caretakers, 20 dinner ladies and 30 cleaners.1300 pupils aged 13-18 years. 3rd year:16 classes;4th year:16 classes;5th year: 12 classes;6th year 8 classes. Subjects taught include: Arts, Sciences, Craft,Commerce & Physical Education. Examinations taken:GCE, CSE, RSA & City and Guilds. 1/3 of all pupils pass 5 or more 'O' levels each year. The 'A' level pass rate is about 74%, of whom about 70% go to Higher Education. The school serves Scissett, Kirkburton, Emley, Skelmanthorpe, Denby Dale and other local villages. There is a small school farm, and an important community service scheme. Modes of transport to school: school buses, service buses, parents' cars, bicycles and some pupils walk.
